page.name: Course Resources
page.content:
Course-Resources

These resources are good sources of more in-depth knowledge of the concepts and practices taught in this course. Use the resources to apply the concepts and to expand your knowledge of integrating the science practices into your adult education classroom. You may want to print this screen for future use.

Links to Explore:

 

Career Interest and Aptitude Inventories:

  • John Holland’s Self-Directed Search - http://www.self-directed-search.com/

  • Strong Interest Inventory - https://www.cpp.com/products/strong/index.aspx

  • EducationWorld – Career Counseling Resources - http://www.educationworld.com/a_curr/curr115.shtml

Job Accommodations Network - http://askjan.org/

My Next Move - http://www.mynextmove.org/

O*NET - Online the primary source of occupational information http://www.onetonline.org/

Career Pathways

  • LINCS: Literacy Information and Communication System - https://lincs.ed.gov

  • Adult Career Pathways Training and Support Center - https://lincs.ed.gov/programs/acp

  • WorkforceGPS, https://www.workforcegps.org/,offers resources and peer-to-peer connection, supplements other TA provided by ETA's national and regional staff to help the public workforce system, education professionals, and business. 

16 Career Clusters Overview

  • CTT: Career Clusters Overview – brief descriptions of each cluster
    https://careertech.org/career-clusters

Locate the nearest American Job Center/One-Stop -
http://www.careeronestop.org/LocalHelp/local-help.aspx

Accommodation Resources

  • Job Accommodation Network (JAN): http://askjan.org/

  • State Education Agencies: 
    http://wdcrobcolp01.ed.gov/Programs/EROD/org_list.cfm?category_cd=DBT

  • Learning Disabilities Association: www.ldanatl.org

  • National Rehabilitation Information Center: http://www.naric.com/

  • RESNA Catalyst Project: http://www.resnaprojects.org

References

Bergen , K. (2006). How 4 people turned learning disabilities into stories of success, fortune and happiness. Chicago, IL: Chicago Tribune. Retrieved from www.allkindsofminds.org

Brown, D. (2004). Learning to work: A story by a learning disabled person.  

Brown, D. (2009). Self-help for learning disabilities. Retrieved from 
http://ldpodcast.blogspot.com/2009/06/dale-brown-self-help-for-learning.html

The Conference Board, Inc., the Partnership for 21st Century Skills, Corporate Voices for Working Families, and the Society for Human Resource Management. (2006). Are they really ready to work? Employers’ Perspectives on the Basic Knowledge and Applied Skills of New Entrants to the 21st Century U.S. Workforce. Retrieved from:
http://www.p21.org/storage/documents/FINAL_REPORT_PDF09-29-06.pdf

Covington, L. E. (2004). Moving beyond the limits of learning: Implications of learning disabilities for adult education. Adult Basic Education: An Interdisciplinary Journal for Adult Literacy Educational Planning, 14(2), 90-103.

Dickinson, D. L. and Verbeek, R. L. (2002). Wage differentials between college graduates with and without learning disabilities. Journal of Learning Disabilities, 35, 175-184

Gerber, P.J., & Price, L.A. (2003) Persons with learning disabilities in the workplace: What we know so far in the Americans with Disabilities Act era. Learning Disabilities: Research & Practice, 18(2), 132-136.

Gregg, N. (2007). Underserved and unprepared: Postsecondary learning disabilities. Learning Disabilities Research & Practice, 2 2(4) [sic], 219-228.

OECD (2013), Time for the U.S. to reskill?: What the survey of adult skills says, OECD Skills Studies, OECD Publishing. https://lincs.ed.gov/professional-development/resource-collections/profile-730

Reder, S. (2014). The impact of ABS Program Participation on Long-Term Economic Outcomes. Retrieved from https://lincs.ed.gov/professional-development/resource-collections/profile-780

U.S. Departments of Labor, Commerce, Education, and Health and Human Services. (2014). What works in job training: A synthesis of the evidence. Retrieved from 
http://www.dol.gov/asp/evaluation/jdt/jdt.pdf

 

 

To print your certificate, please return to the course home page.
